column37: Two respectable efforts in nurseries without looking ahead of her mark; Jack Dace takes off a helpful 5lb but she will need to raise her game a level to win.

column37: Fourth in two 1m2f runs in recent weeks (good to firm and Polytrack); improvement essential now tackling a slower surface.

column37: Shaped with promise when fourth in 1m2f maidens at Ascot (good to firm) and Chepstow (good) in May; should do better and won't need significant progress to play a major role.

column4: British EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB/GBBplus Race)
column19: The greatest improvement could come from one of DESERT SPRING, Berezka or Halcyonic.

column36: Promise amidst inexperience on 7f debut (AW) last October; likely big improver this year
column37: Couldn't go the pace in a 7f fillies' novice at Kempton last October but her final furlong was the fastest of any of the ten runners and showed she had an engine; her fine pedigree points to much better over this sort of trip and a big step forward is expected.

column4: British EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB/GBBplus Race)

column36: Promise over 1m on recent AW debut; should progress as stamina is more fully tested
column37: Encouraging debut when keeping on for fifth at Kempton 17 days ago (1m); lots of stamina in her pedigree and this trip should be more suitable; unexposed and respected.

column4: British EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB/GBBplus Race)
column19: The greatest improvement could come from one of DESERT SPRING, Berezka or Halcyonic.

column36: Dam a smart dual-purpose performer; powerful stable; market useful on debut
column37: First foal of a 1m4f Flat (RPR 103) and bumper/smart 2m-2m3f hurdle winner; this is a rather belated debut but she represents a powerful yard and the betting can guide.

column4: British EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB/GBBplus Race)
column19: The greatest improvement could come from one of DESERT SPRING, Berezka or Halcyonic.

column36: Runner-up in all four runs in 2025 (1m-1m2f); expensive to follow but should go well again
column37: Runner-up in all four runs this year, beaten at odds of 2-9, 11-10 and 10-11 on last three occasions; stays 1m2f but slower than good ground would be a query; should give her running but vulnerable to improvers.

column37: Free-going filly who fared no better than midfield in two AW maidens in May (7f and 1m2f); stable also runs Desert Spring.

column4: Fantastic Fireworks Fillies' Handicap
column19: It may have been a shock but there didn't look to be any fluke about MARGORIE (nap)'s Windsor win and she can progress again over 7f.
column20: 3/1 Secret Sonata,  Dream Illusion, 7/2 Margorie, 5/1 Autumn Rose, 8/1 Magic Music,  Rikissa, 33/1 Grovely Belle
column36: Handicap debutante who has run to a fair level on last two starts; greatly respected
column37: Steady progress with each of her three starts, most recently finishing third of nine at Southwell 18 days ago (7f, AW; made the running); makes her handicap debut at a realistic level and she is greatly respected.

column4: Fantastic Fireworks Fillies' Handicap
column19: It may have been a shock but there didn't look to be any fluke about MARGORIE (nap)'s Windsor win and she can progress again over 7f.
column20: 3/1 Secret Sonata,  Dream Illusion, 7/2 Margorie, 5/1 Autumn Rose, 8/1 Magic Music,  Rikissa, 33/1 Grovely Belle
column36: Big step forward faced with slow ground at Windsor (6f) latest; 7f sure to suit; unexposed
column37: Well beaten on her first two starts (6f, good to firm) but she proved a different proposition faced with soft ground at Windsor (6f) three weeks ago, powering home to spring a 40-1 surprise; the third has since won a handicap (admittedly off a mark of just 58) and this extra furlong looks sure to suit; should have more to offer; interesting.

column4: Fantastic Fireworks Fillies' Handicap
column19: It may have been a shock but there didn't look to be any fluke about MARGORIE (nap)'s Windsor win and she can progress again over 7f.
column20: 3/1 Secret Sonata,  Dream Illusion, 7/2 Margorie, 5/1 Autumn Rose, 8/1 Magic Music,  Rikissa, 33/1 Grovely Belle
column36: Bred to do much better but her opening mark not a gift on racecourse evidence
column37: From a family that has served connections extremely well; her standout effort so far, and the one on which she has earned this opening mark, came in a slowly-run five-runner fillies' novice at Carlisle (7f, good to firm) and it could be misleading; her prolific sisters Al Simmo and Albeseeingyer, and brother Myal, all left their early efforts miles behind when moving into handicaps but none of them were successful on handicap debut.

column4: Fantastic Fireworks Fillies' Handicap

column37: Handicap debutante; minor promise in maidens at 1m-9.5f; may do better now dropped back in trip off what looks a fair opening mark; worth a market check.

column37: Gowran 7f maiden winner who has run well in her last two handicaps, going down by a length at Tipperary and then third from a bad draw at Roscommon; versatile ground-wise and much respected.

column37: Won her maiden by 5l at Naas (1m, good) and travelled well to a point before weakening out of it on last week's handicap debut at Leopardstown (1m; behind Anvika); could yet have more to offer.

column37: Went up 18lb for winning so well at Limerick in June (7f, good) and following second came in a small-field conditions race; only fifth of ten back in a handicap last time and could be on a tough mark.

column37: Her handicap win came over this far last summer; stuck on a losing run but she came from a mile back to be second in a huge field last week at Leopardstown (1m) and Sam Coen takes off 7lb this time; contender.

column37: Won her maiden over C&D but she's 0-10 in handicaps and couldn't live with the winner last time at Roscommon; each-way claims but perhaps vulnerable for win purposes.

column37: Five-time winner; won a 1m5f amateur event here in 2023; two wins since then have come at the Galway races, including last time when a 5l winner of a conditions race (1m6f, yielding); his run at the Curragh prior was underwhelming when well beaten off 97; soft ground is a plus but needs to show he can do it away from Ballybrit.

column36: Went close at Ballinrobe last time and softer ground should suit him; interesting
column37: Four-time winner but last win came two years ago; however, went close at Ballinrobe last time when stepped back up in trip to 1m5f and many of his better efforts have come on softer ground so this should be up his alley; interesting.

column4: John McGuire Handicap

column37: Very useful dual-purpose performer took third in the Irish Lincolnshire this year off 94 (1m, soft); took a conditions hurdle immediately after but below his best back on the Flat following that at the Curragh and in a Grade 3 hurdle at Tipperary; comfortable winner of a two-runner hurdle at Cork last time; won't mind conditions underfoot.

column4: John McGuire Handicap
column19: This has an open look to it with CRISTAL CLERE given the tentative nod to gain his first win since 2023 on ground he likes

column36: Won at Roscommon last time when upped in trip; could be improvement off 6lb higher
column37: 6-38 with three of those coming at Galway; some moderate runs since winning there in September last year but won at Roscommon last time with 1.75l back to Granite Bay; that was just his second run over 8.5f, so there could be more improvement in him; must overcome 6lb rise but ground in his favour.

column4: John McGuire Handicap

column36: Winner here last year and was close behind Clear Quartz at Roscommon last time
column37: Bagged third win of his career when winning at this festival last year (1m6f, yielding); no wins since but some decent efforts in defeat including when 1.75l behind Clear Quartz at Roscommon last time (1m4f, soft); can go well again.

column37: Got fifth Flat win at Leopardstown in May off 78 (1m4f, good) and has posted some decent efforts since, including when a neck second at Clonmel last time over an extended 2m on soft; that was a lifetime best on RPRs and this drop back in trip should do him no harm; 3lb rise to overcome.

column37: Last year's winner has dropped to 4lb below that winning mark following some poor runs in the interim; but has also run with credit, including when keeping on for a 4.25l fourth at Galway on his penultimate run; not ruled out back to the scene of his victory.

column37: Got first Flat win at Limerick in June when running out a comfortable victor (12.5f, good); not a bad run in a Galway festival handicap (1m4f, yielding) in early August but still 9lb above last winning mark.

column37: In flying form recently, winning at Roscommon (12.5f, yielding) before following up at the Galway races when upped in trip, with Burren Song .5l behind (1m4f, yielding); another positive effort at Sligo four days later under a penalty when second (10.5f, good to yielding); back up in trip looks the right move and not ruled out.

column37: Second foal; dam won Forever Together (by Galileo) won the Oaks, sister to 1m 2yo Group 1 winner Together Forever, half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Lord Shanakill, out of unraced half-sister to US 1m1f Grade 1 winner Spanish Fern.

column37: Versatile sort won a Tipperary novice chase in July before finishing 4.5l behind the sprightly Lord Erskine in a Killarney Flat handicap (2m1f, yielding to soft); back-to-back runner-up finishes in small-field chases followed before another solid effort back on the Flat at Clonmel last time (2m, soft); ground is a concern.

column37: Won a 1m4f French conditions event (good to soft) on debut last September; struggled in two hurdle starts for Harry Fry and hasn't beaten a rival in two starts for current yard; can only be watched for now; makes handicap debut.

column37: Two-time 1m4f good to soft ground winner in Germany; four moderate runs for new yard; steps back up in trip again.

column37: Three seconds for William Haggas but had failed to make frame in six starts for Denis Hogan before dropping in grade to take a good ground Roscommon claimer over an extended 1m2f in his final start for that outfit last month; can't be ruled out but others preferred.

column37: Record of 1-27 with her win coming three years ago doesn't inspire hugely, but she has been running well in defeat recently; beaten a head at Down Royal in first-time cheekpieces off 62 in July (1m5f, good); creditable runs at Galway and Killarney following that (a neck behind Ehteyat at Killarney); interesting.
